result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan B Ferra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Restitution refund check packet
JOC corrected to include that the defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant is NOT on Probation.  Restitution, costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 02-17-2017 or Civil Judgment WITH Tax Intercept.  sdg

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Nathan B Ferra in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve NINETY (90) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER CASE with credit for THIRTY-NINE DAYS served.  STRAIGHT TIME.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Restitution payable to KMART for FOUR HUNDRED TWENTY-EIGHT DOLLARS AND EIGHTY-ONE CENTS ($428.81) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges, supervision fees and restitution BY 02-17-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH TAX INTERCEPT.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Nathan B Ferra in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense moved to have Defendant's NEW case (15CM3888) transferred to Br. 33.  State does not object.  Court ACCEPTED the new matter into Br. 33.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Barbara K Due for Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Attorney Rablin WAS contacted prior to the case being called on the Record.

Defendant failing to appear, On motion of the State, Court LIFTS THE STAY AND ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense requests Bench Warrant be STAYED.  State does NOT object.  COURT ISSUES AND STAYS BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
State has not been able to notify the victim in this matter.  Case adjourned to 12-01-2015 at 3:00pm.  sdg
JusticePoint Pre-trial Report.  Dated 10-23-2015.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Violation Report dated 10-16-2015.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in Court with Attorney Dawn Rablin.  Brad Vorpahl appears for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Matter before the Court for Sentencing.  Due to the congestion of the Court's calendar and lateness of the hour, Court Orders case adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State needs additional time to contact victim.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 33  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. cmt

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has pending case 15CM2263.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Defense counsel requests that 15CM2263 be set for sentencing with this case.   Court ordered cases adjourned for sentencing in Branch 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

15RM036558  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/05/15

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Nathan B Ferra in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Discharge Summary from JusticePoint received and filed.  LMS
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant not in compliance.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
Justice Point Report, received and filed.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 310 Safety Building on 4/13/15 @ 1:30 pm
